title: Quantitative Peer Learning Community R Training
text:
There has been a growing demand amongst Bellwarians to learn R to support them in data cleaning, analysis and visualization. To support Bellwarians in developing their R skills, the Quantitaive PLC is providing a 9 week course that will teach them how to do the following:

Data cleaning and analysis
Join two or more data frames
Advanced data visualizations, including charts, graphs, and maps
Create high-quality presentations using Quarto

title: Quantitative Peer Learning Community R Training
text: When the window opens to pass major education funding reform, advocates need deep policy and technical expertise to influence the legislation. This session will introduce advocates to the technical tools needed to become a trusted authority for modeling potential changes to their state’s school funding formula. Participants will get a crash course in building data analysis and modeling skills, hear from other advocates who’ve put these skills to use to shape policy, and get to know colleagues across the Network who can support future funding reform efforts.

Setup

The R language is open-source software available at through the Comprehensive R Archive Network, CRAN. Select the version of R that is compatiable with your operating system.
Once you’ve downloaded the installer, go ahead and run it to install R on your computer.

title: Setup
text:
Step 2: Install RStudio
RStudio is an open-source integrated development environment (IDE) designed to improve your R programming experience. It is available to download through Posit, a public benefit corporation (PBC) that develops open-source software.
Again, once you’ve downloaded the installer, go ahead and run it to install RStudio on your computer.

title: Setup
text:
Step 3: Install required packages
Packages help make R easier to use by providing useful functions and data. During this training, we will use the following packages:

tidyverse: This package is actually a collection of packages that provide essential tools for data cleaning (dplyr) and visualization (ggplot2). Census Bureau that has been cleaned using EdBuild’s methodology for handling such data.
remotes: This package allows you to download packages hosted on GitHub, such as edbuildr.
readxl: This package allows you to read in excel documents to do data cleaning and analysis.

To install these packages, open RStudio and copy the code below. In the “Console” pane, paste the code and run it by hitting return:

install.packages(c("tidyverse", "readxl", "remotes"))

remotes::install_github("edbuild/edbuildr")
